summary: Immigration agents raided an Oklahoma City home rented by a family of U.S. citizens and pointed guns in their faces, âtraumatizingâ them âfor life,â they said. The agents were looking for the homeâs previous tenants.
An ICE agent pulled a gun on a woman as her father was being detained in Memphis, Tennessee, video shows.

An immigration agent pointed a gun at the pastor of Downey Memorial Christian Church in Downey, California. Reverend Tanya Lopez had approached agents in the parking lot and told them she was uncomfortable with them being on the property, leading one of them to point a gun at her.
Protester Vincent Hawkins, 55, an emergency room nurse, was hit in the eye with a rubber bullet fired by ICE agents at a detention facility in Portland, Oregon.
A plainclothes immigration agent jumped out of his vehicle at a stoplight and drew his gun on someone attempting to photograph his license plate in Pasadena, California, video shows.

Immigration agents marched through MacArthur Park in Los Angeles in what Homeland Security officials said was an enforcement operation. Some of the agents pointed weapons at journalists and other observers.

A news photographer was hit twice by less-lethal rounds while covering a clash between protesters and federal agents during an immigration raid at a cannabis farm near Camarillo, California. Protesters were shot with pepper balls.

ICE agents detained a man at his home in North Charleston, South Carolina. When the manâs partner came outside and asked why the agents were there, one of them shoved her and pointed a gun at her, camera footage shows.
An ICE agent fired three shots into a car that officers say tried to run them over during a operation in Black Forest, Colorado. No injuries were reported.
Andreina Mejiaâs son, a 15-year-old boy with speech and hearing disabilities, was arrested at gunpoint in Los Angeles after agents mistook him for a suspected MS-13 pledge.
CBP agents opened fire on a car after it drove away during a traffic stop in San Bernardino, California. No one was injured.

Silverio Villegas-GonzÃ¡lez, 38, a Mexican national, was shot and killed by an ICE officer after dragging the officer with his car in the Chicago suburb of Franklin Park. The agency said he had resisted arrest during a traffic stop. The officer later said his injuries were ânothing major.â
Federal agents detained a landscaper and his two sons â both U.S. citizens â at a gas station in Des Plaines, Illinois. One agent drew a gun and another tased one of the sons in the face.
Protesters outside an ICE facility in Broadview, Illinois, were shot with pepper balls. Presbyterian pastor the Rev. David Black was shot in the face with a pepper ball while praying.
Agents at the ICE processing center in Broadview, Illinois, shot pepper balls at protesters.

ICE agents smashed the window of a car carrying a couple and their 1-month-old baby and held them at gunpoint in Alamosa, Colorado, video footage shows. They were on their way home from the courthouse. A CBP agent shattered the driverâs side window and detained the driver. The driver was later deported to Mexico.
A pair of ICE agents pointed their handguns at bystanders who were filming the agents as they struggled to handcuff a man on the ground in Hyattsville, Maryland.
An ICE agent dropped his handgun while trying to make an arrest in Prince George's County, Maryland. The agent then appeared to point the gun at bystanders.

Agents fired pepper balls and rubber bullets at protesters and journalists outside the ICE processing facility in Broadview, Illinois. A sniper on the roof fired baton rounds toward the crowd, shattering the windows of a nearby business.
Agents at the ICE processing center in Broadview, Illinois, fired pepper balls at protesters.

An agent at the ICE processing center in Broadview, Illinois, shot a pepper ball at a news van belonging to the local CBS affiliate. The passengers, including CBS reporter Asal Rezaei, were overcome by chemical irritants. âAbsolutely unprovoked,â she posted on social media. âBeen puking for two hours.â
Some 300 immigration agents stormed an apartment complex in Chicago, ordering residents out at gunpoint and deploying flash-bang grenades.
A woman observing immigration arrests at a Home Depot in Cicero, Illinois, said a CBP agent aimed a gun at her, according to a class-action lawsuit.
Border Patrol agents shot pepper balls at onlookers and protesters outside Funston Elementary School on Chicago's Northwest Side.

A Chicago woman who had been warning residents about ICE was shot five times and wounded by a CBP agent after federal agents rammed her car, video shows. Marimar Martinez had a handgun in her purse and a valid concealed carry license. She was charged with assaulting, impeding, and interfering with federal law enforcement, but prosecutors dropped the charges.

During an immigration raid at Concordia Cemetery in Forest Park, Illinois, federal agents fired pepper balls at workers and detained them for several hours. The Department of Homeland Security said the workers were trying to impede the arrest of undocumented immigrants.

Dayanne Figueroa, an American citizen living in Chicago, was pulled from her car and held at gunpoint. The incident was captured on video. Figueroa, who had recently underwent kidney surgery, said she suffered severe bruising and nerve damage following her detention and arrest.
Photojournalist Matthew Kaplan documented an immigration agent pointing a gun at a man who was filming a raid and the protest that followed in Chicago.

Two men in Gresham, Oregon, were detained by immigration authorities who raided their home with rifles drawn, video shows. They didnât have a warrant. A 3-month-old baby was inside at the time. It was a case of mistaken identity and the men were eventually released.

A Homeland Security Investigations agent fired shots at an unarmed man during a traffic stop in Washington, D.C. He wasn't injured in the shooting. The man was jailed for three days before a judge dismissed the case.

During a raid on an allegedly illegal gambling operation in Wilder, Idaho, that resulted in the arrest of more than 100 people, officers used flash-bang devices, pointed guns at people, and deployed a pepper bomb.

A pregnant driver in Berwyn, Illinois, was honking her horn to alert people to the presence of ICE agents when one of them began walking toward her with his gun raised, video footage shows. The agent told her she was impeding their pursuit of two suspects. âI started going off on him,â she said. ââYouâre really gonna shoot a pregnant woman?ââ

Immigration agents pointed a gun at Illinois State Representative Hoan Huynh after boxing in his car in Chicagoâs Albany Park neighborhood, according to a statement from his office. Huynh and his staffers had been driving through the neighborhood trying to warn people about the agentsâ presence.

A deputy U.S. marshal fired shots at a well-known TikToker during an immigration raid in South Los Angeles. Carlitos Ricardo Parias, a.k.a. "Richard LA," who regularly follows ICE, was injured, as was a federal marshal struck by a ricochet bullet. The Department of Homeland Security said Parias tried to evade arrest by ramming law enforcement vehicles. ICE bodycam video showed agents boxing in his car.
A federal agent pointed a gun at a combat veteran and said âbang, bangâ and âyouâre dead, liberalâ during an immigration raid in Chicago's Little Village neighborhood.
The Rev. Jorge Bautista of the United Church of Christ was shot with pepper balls during a prayer vigil at the entrance to a planned ICE facility in Alameda, California.
ICE agents fired pepper balls at a woman driving in Aurora, Illinois. Sheâd pulled into a parking lot behind one of the agents. Her kids, ages 1 and 3, were also in the car.
An ICE officer shot an undocumented driver in Tempe, Arizona, as he sped away from a traffic stop. Jose Garcia-Sorto was wounded and remains in ICE custody.
CBP agents conducting a raid on a parking lot for ride-share drivers at Chicago's Oï¿½ï¿½Hare International Airport tased a man they accused of ramming their vehicle.

Carlos Jimenez, a U.S. citizen, was shot and wounded by ICE after warning a group of federal agents about children gathering at a nearby school bus stop in Ontario, California. He was headed to his job at a food bank when he noticed the officers blocking traffic, his lawyers said.

A man's car collided with a vehicle carrying federal agents outside a rehabilitation center in Evanston, Illinois. One of the agents pointed a handgun at protesters. Agents fired pepper balls at the crowd.

An immigration agent repeatedly pointed a weapon at onlookers and threatened to shoot them while attempting to restrain a woman in Evanston, Illinois. A video taken by a bystander shows the agent at least twice pulling a weapon out of his holster while witnesses tell him to âput the gun away.â

Immigration agents pointed rifles at bystanders as they raided an apartment complex in unincorporated Northbrook, Illinois. âICE basically held 90 apartments hostage while theyâre trying to get to one man,â a resident said.
An ICE agent brandished his weapon toward a woman following and observing immigration officers in Santa Ana, California, video shows.
A plainclothes ICE officer held a woman at gunpoint in Fullerton, California, prompting local police to intervene.

An off-duty ICE agent pointed a gun at a 17-year-old as the teen drove in Riverside, California. The agent demanded the teen pull over, pulled him out of the car at gunpoint, and began interrogating him. The agent was arrested for illegally detaining a minor.
Immigration agents forced their way into a basement apartment in Queens, New York, and held a mother and her four children at gunpoint.

A Homeland Security Investigations agent shot at a car during a police chase in Washington, D.C. Local police and federal officers were patrolling together when the car ran a red light. No one was injured.
Border Patrol agents pointed an assault rifle through a smashed car window before detaining a woman in Charlotte, North Carolina.

Kerly Sosa Rivero, 16, was held at gunpoint by ICE agents during an early morning raid of her Detroit home. She was arrested and transferred to a Texas detention facility. Rivero was formally seeking asylum in the United States.
Immigration agents pointed guns at roofers in Kenner, Louisiana, before arresting them.

A student was detained on the campus of Augsburg University, a private university in Minneapolis, by agents who refused to provide a warrant. Agents pointed weapons at the crowd of students recording the scene and at staff members, school officials said.

More than a dozen ICE agents forced their way inside a home in Burnsville, Minnesota, and detained several residents after making them hand over their phones and holding them at gunpoint, home surveillance video shows.

ICE agents held a married couple in their 60s at gunpoint in Richfield, Minnesota. The pair had been following the agents at a distance in their car. After the agents turned into a parking lot, they used their vehicles to box the couple in, then jumped out and pointed weapons at them, according to a class-action lawsuit.

A Border Patrol agent fatally shot Isaias Sanchez Barboza, 31, a Mexican national who federal authorities said was fleeing capture during an enforcement action near the U.S.-Mexico border in Rio Grande City, Texas.

An off-duty CBP agent fired his gun several times during a confrontation with another motorist on an access road to John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City. The agent told authorities that he pulled his weapon after the other driver attacked him over a fender bender. No one was injured.

An ICE agent fired shots at an SUV in St. Paul, Minnesota, claiming the driver had hit multiple agents with his car while evading a traffic stop. The motorist, an undocumented Cuban national, was not injured. He was later charged with assaulting a federal officer.

ICE agents shot at a van during an immigration enforcement traffic stop in Glen Burnie, Maryland, striking and wounding the driver. An ICE spokesperson said Tiago Alexandre Sousa-Martins, a Portuguese national, rammed into several ICE cars when asked to turn his car off.

An off-duty ICE agent fatally shot Keith Porter Jr., 43, who witnesses say was firing a rifle into the air to celebrate New Yearâs in the Northridge neighborhood of Los Angeles. The Department of Homeland Security claimed the agent âbravely responded to an active shooter situation.â Civil rights leaders called for an investigation.

Immigration agents in Minneapolis shot and killed Renee Nicole Good, 37, claiming she rammed her car into them. Video showed her backing up and driving away from the agents before they fired. Local officials rejected Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noemâs assertion that the agents fired in self-defense. âThe presence of federal immigration enforcement agents is causing chaos in our city,â Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey subsequently posted on X.

A Minneapolis pastor said ICE agents waved a gun in his face after he joined a protest outside his church. When he noticed agents surrounding a woman of color he told them to arrest him instead. He was detained for an hour.

CBP agents shot a man and a woman in a medical clinic parking lot in Portland, Oregon. Luis David Nino Moncada and Yorlenys Betzabeth Zambrano-Contreras were in a truck that had been boxed in by agents trying to make a traffic stop. The Department of Homeland Security claimed the victims were undocumented and associated with the Venezuelan organized crime syndicate Tren de Aragua.

ICE agents fired pepper balls at protesters outside the Bishop Henry Whipple Federal Building in Minneapolis. One agent aimed a long gun at someone filming the scene, and another agent pointed a handgun at a protester.
incident_type: Less-lethal munitions, Brandishing by immigration agent

summary: A protester was permanently blinded in his left eye after a Homeland Security officer fired a less-lethal round at close range during a confrontation outside the federal building in Santa Ana, California. âI had shards of metal, glass, and plastic behind my eye and in my skull. They said it was a miracle I survived,â the protester said. A Homeland Security official said members of the crowd had been throwing rocks, bottles, and fireworks at officers.

ICE agents fired pepper balls at protesters and journalists during a demonstration outside the Bishop Henry Whipple Federal Building in Minneapolis. A cameraman was hit in the leg with a flash bang grenade.

Federal agents rammed the door of a Minneapolis home and pushed their way inside at gunpoint while searching for a Liberian national with a removal order. His 9-year-old child was home at the time. The agents did not have a warrant to enter the home.

An ICE officer shot and wounded a man during an immigration enforcement operation in north Minneapolis. Julio Cesar Sosa-Celis, a Venezuelan national, reportedly fled a traffic stop, and when federal agents caught up with him, two people emerged from a nearby apartment and attacked the officer with a shovel, federal authorities said. The Department of Homeland Security claims the officer fired in self-defense, hitting Sosa-Celis in the leg.

ICE agents with guns drawn detained a 57-year-old Hmong man in his St. Paul, Minnesota, home and then marched him outside half-dressed in below-zero wind chill. His 5-year-old grandson was napping on the sofa and âwoke up crying in fear.â The man was driven around, questioned, fingerprinted, and eventually released because he is a U.S. citizen with no criminal history.

A federal agent fired his weapon during an immigration enforcement operation in Willowbrook, an unincorporated community in Los Angeles, California. No one was injured. The Department of Homeland Security said its agents were investigating a human smuggling operation when a suspect rammed their vehicle.
Matthew James Obadiah Allen, a Minneapolis rapper who goes by Nur-D, was shot with rubber bullets and pepper balls while protesting the killing of Alex Pretti by Border Patrol agents.

Alex Pretti, 37, was shot and killed while filming Border Patrol agents outside a donut shop in Minneapolis. Department of Homeland Security officials said he was armed and that a gun was recovered at the scene. Minneapolis Police Chief Brian O'Hara said the victim was a lawful gun owner with a permit to carry.
Someone was shot and critically wounded in an incident involving Border Patrol agents in Pima County, Arizona.
